results.title: Conformity and independence (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Stanley Milgram, Harry From and Calvin Communications
results.brief_description: The topic of conformity is at the heart of any course in social psychology, and any treatment of the topic must rely heavily on the classic materials of Sherif, Asch and to a lesser extent Milgram, Kelman, Crutchfield, Moscovici, etc. The phenomena of conformity are relevant to the students’ own experience. Demonstrates laboratory work while maximising student involvement.

results.title: Conflict of interest (D)
results.creator_credit: Tony Wellington, Ian MacArthur and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The basis of this film is the National Park and Wildlife Services kangaroo control and management program. The kangaroo is shown, historically, as a source of food for the Aborigines, as game and a source of income for the first Europeans and today as a symbol of Australia. The Kangaroo Management Program is discussed at length. It aims to ensure the conservation of all species of macropods, the investigation of agricultural damage and the best use of product derived from culling kangaroos. Statistical information on kangaroo culling is presented diagramatically.

results.title: Conflict
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
Descriptions and illustrations of the four classes of motivational conflict (after Dollard and Millar) are shown, demonstrating the basic research on animals and then generalising this into an understanding of human behaviour. Laboratory animals (rats, in this case) in a typical T-maze experiment point out the principles used in analysing and interpreting the behaviour of high school and university students.

results.title: Conflict
results.creator_credit: Halina Sztynda, Melanie Guiney and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: Presents the views of the Forest Commission, loggers and conservationists in regard to logging practices in East Gippsland. Allows the viewer to draw conclusions about the attitudes and prejudices of the conservationists and the loggers and saw millers.

results.title: Confidential Report = Mr Arkadin
results.creator_credit: Orson Welles, Louis Dolivet and Sevilla Studios
results.brief_description: Two corpses on the Naples quayside lead Guy Van Stratten into the bizarre world of Mr Arkadin, a fabulously rich tycoon with a beautiful daughter and a shady past, which he claims to have forgotten. Van Stratten is hired to investigate - with murderous results. Welles’ second European film returned to the fascination with total power which had made “Citizen Kane” his youthful masterpiece. Arkadin is closer to Harry Lime than to Kane, because he is a profiteer … who nourishes himself on the corruption of the universe. Stars Michael Redgrave, Katina Paxinou and Akim Tamiroff.

results.title: Confidence in contact
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Better Rugby”.
New methods of introducing and developing the techniques of tackling in rugby football. After building surprising ability and confidence in junior players, Barry John (Wales and British Lions) and Willie John McBride (Ireland and British Lions) show how the same coaching methods can be used in giving senior players complete confidence in going in for the tackle.

results.title: Confessions of a Train Spotter
results.brief_description: Michael Palin fulfils his dream as a childhood train spotter and travels the length of Britain by train - from Euston to the Kyle of Lochalsh - on a fascinating journey of history and rediscovery. Rated: G

results.title: Confessions of a Simple Surgeon
results.creator_credit: Paul Harmon and Educational Division of N S W Dept of TAFE
results.brief_description: This humorous presents the associated health risks of smoking and passive smoking in an often graphic but factual manner. “Confessions” calls for a total ban on tobacco promotion and its message to viewers is clear. If you smoke, quit. If you don’t , don’t be conned into smoking and avoid being a victim of passive smoking. It is presented by Dr Arthur Chesterfield-Evans, whose experience in surgery on cancer victims led him to become an activist in BUGAUP (Billboard Utilising Graffitists Against Unhealthy Promotions) and in the legal activities of the Non-Smokers Movement of Australia.

results.title: Confessions of a Headhunter
results.creator_credit: Sally Riley, Archie Weller and Scarlett Pictures
results.brief_description: In the film, two Noongar men – Frank and Vinnie – travel across the country and seek revenge for the repeated beheading of the statue of their ancestor warrior Yagan.

constellations_other.name: Laughing in the face of adversity
constellations_other.description: Comedy has been used by First Nations storytellers as a tool for social change. On our screens, humour invites audiences to engage with stories and prompts them to grapple with ideas that they otherwise might shy away from.

results.title: Confession from the Commander's diary: a narration in five parts
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Observing the rituals, gestures and trance-like states of his crew, a naval Commander ponders his life. How did he get here? What went wrong? And right? Will he ever know light again? Probing the dark, unspecified seas, the ship becomes contemporary Russia: dazzling midnight snowstorms; plain human actions shaped by centuries of weariness and wanting; persistence; inquiry.
